_comment: Created by ianb on 04/10/2013 12:59:16 using v0.9
title: How have perceptions of inpatient toilets cleanliness changed?
analysis_commentary: The proportion of patients who said the toilets and bathrooms they used in hospital were 'very clean' increased between 2005 and 2012, from 46% to 61%, while the proportion who found the toilets and bathrooms 'fairly clean' or 'very clean' increased from 86% to 94%. Correspondingly the proportion of patients who found the toilets and bathrooms 'not very clean' or 'not clean at all' dropped from 13% in 2005 to 6% in 2012.
data_source: Care Quality Commission, Survey of Adult Inpatients and Survey of Outpatients
